meanings.definition: Graff (noun): A form of urban art involving the use of spray paint or markers to create images or words on public surfaces.
meanings.sent1: The colorful graff on the wall brightened up the alley.
meanings.sent2: The city was filled with graff on buildings and bridges.
meanings.sent3: The graff of a smiling sun on the sidewalk made people stop and smile.
meanings.sent4: The graff of a roaring lion seemed to come to life in the moonlight.
meanings.sent5: The graff of a train racing through the city was both exciting and beautiful.

meanings.sent1: He decided to graff his name on the abandoned building.
meanings.sent2: The artist loved to graff on the train cars at night.
meanings.sent3: She graffed a heart with their initials as a surprise for her partner.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti artist graffed a message of hope on the old brick wall.
meanings.sent5: They graffed a mural of unity on the community center wall for all to see.

meanings.definition: Graff (adjective): Relating to graffiti or street art.
meanings.sent1: The graff designs on the subway were eye-catching.
meanings.sent2: She wore a graff-inspired jacket to the art show.
meanings.sent3: The graff patterns on the skateboard gave it a cool vibe.
meanings.sent4: His graff style was recognized and admired by many in the city.
meanings.sent5: The graff culture in the neighborhood brought life and color to the streets.
